Info.Description: The Lizardmen, sometimes known as the Cold Ones or the Children of the Gods, are an ancient, savage, intelligent race of cold-blooded, reptilian humanoids that were at one time the first and oldest civilisation of the Warhammer World. Long before the rise of Men, Elf or Dwarf, the empire of the Lizardmen ruled supreme.\n\nAlien, enigmatic, and without mercy, the Lizardmen were there when it all began and will be there when the world draws its last dying breath, never tiring nor relenting until order is finally restored to this uncaring, chaotic world. Such is what they were made to do, for they are the ancient servants of the Old Ones, the one true protectors of this very world

Magic.Name: The Lore of Heaven
Magic.Options: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic
Magic.Enemy: Warriors of Chaos, The Lore of Nurgle

Weapon.Name: Blade of Realities
Weapon.Lore: Brought to the world by the gods, this weapon shimmers in and out of existence, existing in more than one plane of reality, and can sever the souls of those it touches
Weapon.Description: For each successful hit inflicted by this weapon, the victim must pass a Leadership test or be slain instantly. No armour, ward or regeneration saves are allowed against this special attack. If the tests are passed, roll to Wound and save as normal

Weapon.Name: Blade of Revered Tzanuki
Weapon.Lore: Said to be the weapon wielded by the Old One Tzunki, this exquisitely crafted weapon is is unbreakable, and bas survived the most intense dragonfire unscathed, remaining icy cold to the touch afterwards. Such is its craftsmanship that it hums as it cuts through the air
Weapon.Description: +1 Strenght. No armour saves are allowed against attacks made by the Blade of Revered Tzanuki

Weapon.Name: Scimitar of the Sun Resplendent
Weapon.Lore: As light as a dagger, this curved blade invigorates the wielder with the power of the sun, fuelling his charge with fiery vigour
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this blade has +2 Attacks

Weapon.Name: Stegadon War-spear
Weapon.Lore: The tip of this massive spear was carved from the born of the very first and greatest Stegadon to bear a war howdah. The gnarled horns of this beast, inlaid with magical runes, were said to be so bard they could shatter mountains with ease
Weapon.Description: Lance. In addition, the bearer's mount inflicts 2D6+1 impact hits rather then the normal 1D6+1

Weapon.Name: Staff of the Lost Sun
Weapon.Lore: A staff made from a metal of alien manufacture, the Staff of the Lost Sun projects beams of hot light from its tip, searing the flesh of those caught in the blast
Weapon.Description: The staff is treated as a short bow that has a Strenght of 5, and 3x Multiple Shots

Weapon.Name: Piranha Blade
Weapon.Lore: The blade of this weapon is inlaid with thousands of tiny barbed teeth that rip and tear anything that they touch
Weapon.Description: Any unsaved wound inflicted by the Piranha Blade is multipled into two wounds

Weapon.Name: Dagger of Sotek
Weapon.Lore: This sacred ceremonial dagger bas taken thousands of sacrifices to the bloodthirsty Sotek. The rat-kin particularly fear this weapon, for it bas been the doom of many of their number
Weapon.Description: Confers on the bearer the killing blow ability. In addition, the bearer causes Fear in Skaven

Weapon.Name: Sword of the Hornet
Weapon.Lore: When this sword is unsheathed, the bearer is granted visions of the future, seeing events seconds before they happen. Forewarned of his enemy's attack, the sword's wielder can pre-empt their blows with his own
Weapon.Description: The bearer of this sword has the 'Always Strikes First' rule

Weapon.Name: Burning Blade of Chotec
Weapon.Lore: An acrid smell of sulphur exudes from the barbed blades on this weapon. It passes easily through armour, blackening and buckling steel and causing searing wounds that blister and smoke
Weapon.Description: Flaming attacks. Targets struck by the Burning of Chotek suffer a -2 penalty to their armour save in addition to any modifiers from the user's Strength

Armour.Name: Hide of the Cold Ones
Armour.Lore: Only the toughest of Saurus Warriors can don the Hide of the Cold Ones, making his appearance fearsome to behold. However, the hide exudes a toxic slime that slowly poisons the user and dulls his mind
Armour.Description: Heavy armour. The wearer causes Fear and has +1 Toughness, but becomes subject to Stupidity

Additional.Name: Sacred Stegadon Helm
Additional.Lore: This mighty horned bone helmet is a potent symbol of power and respect. Those who wear it are accorded much reverence, for it is said that only those chosen by the Old Ones can place it on their heads without being struck down
Additional.Description: Confers +1 to the model's armour save, which may be combined with other armour as normal. In addition, the helm adds +1 to the model's Leadership

Shield.Name: Shield of the Mirrored Pool
Shield.Description: Shield. Any magic missile that strikes the bearer or any unit he is with is reflected on the roll of 2+ on a D6. If the spell is reflected, the results of the magic missile are resolved against the caster of the spell or the unit the character is with. This in turn cannot be dispelled

Shield.Name: The Mainming Shield
Shield.Lore: The face of this shield is dark and reflective, and ripples spread from its centre when it deflects blows. Hostile enemy magic is absorbed by this ancient piece of armour, and may be rebounded back at the caster
Shield.Description: Shield. The Mainming Shield confres +1 Attack to the bearer. This additional attack is worked out using the base Strength of the wielder, and counts as magical

Additional.Name: The Horn of Kygor
Additional.Lore: It was said that the legendary Saurus Kygor, the first owner of this magical hom, could stare down a frenzied Camosaur and that his bellowing roar could halt a stampeding Stegadon
Additional.Description: Friendly cavalry within 12" are Stubborn. Enemy cavalry Fear the bearer

Additional.Name: Horned One
Additional.Description: Cold One. The Horned One has a Movement of 8, an Initiative of 3, and is not subject to Stupidity

Arcane.Name: Divine Plaque of Protection
Arcane.Description: The Slann's Shield of the Old Ones ward save in increased from 4+ to 2+ against the ranged attacks

Additional.Name: War Drum of Xahutec
Additional.Rule: +1 Leadership to friendly unit attempting to rally
Additional.Description: The presence of enemy units within 8" does not stop the bearer and any unit he is eith from marching. In addition any friendly unit attemptiong to rally within 12" of the War Drum gains an additional +a Leadership, up to a maximum of 10, so long as the bearer is not fleeing

Additional.Name: Blood Statuette of Spite
Additional.Description: Bounded Spell. Power Level 5. One use only. Once per game, the user may cast the spell bound within the statuette. The spell may be cast on any enemy character. That character must immediately take Toughness test. If this test is failed, then the model loses a Wound with no armour saves allowed. If the model takes a wound, it must immediately take another Toughness test, losing another wound if it fails again. This continues until either the model passes a Toughness test or is slain

Additional.Name: Charm of the Jaguar Warrior
Additional.Description: Bound Spell. Power Level 5. The Charm of th Jaguar Warrior contains the bound spell Steed of Shadows, as detailed in the Lore of Shadow in the Warhammer rulebook. The spell may only be cast on the bearer himself

Additional.Name: Cloak of Feathers
Additional.Description: The wearer of the cloack may fly

Additional.Name: Carnosaur Pendant
Additional.Description: Once the bearer has inficted a wound, he will become immediately subject to Frenzy. The bearer will never lose its Frenzy, even if it is beaten in combat. See the main rulebook for details of Frenzy

Arcane.Name: Curse-Charm of Tepok
Arcane.Description: Only one use. When the enemy rolls on the Miscast table, the bearer of the Curse-Charm of Tepok may force him to re-roll the result. This second result stands

Weapon.Name: Bane Head
Weapon.Rule: Unsaved wounds doubled for nominated target
Weapon.Description: Nominate an enemy character at the start of the battle. All unsaved wounds caused by the bearer on the nominated target are doubled

Additional.Name: Dragonfly of Quicksilver
Additional.Description: If both players have models with the Scout ability, the Lizardmen player adds 1 to his dice roll when rolling to see eho deploys their Scouts first

Additional.Name: Venom of the Firefly Frog
Additional.Description: All mundane weapons used by the bearer are coated with this venom. In addition to the weapons normal rules, all attackes made with them count as Poisoned Attacks and magical. Mundane weapons that already make Poisoned Attacks may re-roll the dice to hit

Arcane.Name: Cupped Hands of the Old Ones
Arcane.Description: One use only. If the bearer miscasts, roll a D6. On a roll of 1 the bearer suffers the results of the miscast as normal. On 2+ the miscast is ignored and if there is an enemy Wizard within line of sight he will suffer its effects, ignoring result 5-6

Arcane.Name: Cube of Darkness
Arcane.Rule: On 4+ all Ramains in Play spells are dispelled
Arcane.Description: One use only. This is used as a Dispell Scroll. When used, roll a D6. On 4+ all Remains in Play spells are automatically dispelled and the Magic phase ends immediately

Arcane.Name: Rode of the Storm
Arcane.Description: Bound Spell. Power Level 6. One use only. The Rod of the Storm contains the bound spell Uranon's Thunderbold as detailed in the Lore of Heavens in the Warhammer rulebook

Arcane.Name: Diadem of power
Arcane.Rule: Two power dice save for dispel
Arcane.Description: The Wizard may save up to two of his unused power dice at the end of his Magic phase and add them to his side's dispel dice pool in the next enemy Magic phase

Arcane.Name: Plaque of Tepok
Arcane.Description: The Wizard bearing the plaque knows one more spell then he would normally be allowed

Additional.Name: Aura of Quetzl
Additional.Description: All close combat attacks made against the bearer suffer -1 to Hit

Additional.Name: Glyph Necklace
Additional.Description: The character wearing this gains a 5+ ward save

Additional.Name: Amulet of Itza
Additional.Description: One use only. The character wearing this amulet has a 2+ ward save against the first wound suffered, after Armour saves have boon taken

Banner.Name: Plaque of Dominion
Banner.Description: The plaque can be used at the beginning of any enemy turn. Each enemy Wizard within 18" that can draw a line of sight to the plaque or the unit it is with must take a Stupidity test

Banner.Name: Sun Standart of Chotec
Banner.Description: Missles fired at the unit from within 12" suffer an additional -2 to Hit, or -1 to Hit if fired from over 12" away

Banner.Name: Huanchi's Blessed Totem
Banner.Description: One use only. The unit can add D6" to its charge move. If the charge is failed, the unit will move forward at its normal movement rate

Banner.Name: Jaguar Standard
Banner.Description: The unit pursues an extra D6"

Banner.Name: Skavenpelt Banner
Banner.Description: The unit is subject to Frenzy until defeat in combet. In addition the unit Hates all units in the Skaven army

Lord.Name: Lord Kroak
Lord.Description: Venerable Lord Kroak, Defender of Itza, is said to have been the first of the Slann Mage-Priests spawned upon the world, the eldest of the fabled First Generation. The mysterious Old One Тероk taught Kroak of the Winds of Magic, and it was the serene Potec who shared the secrets of unwinding the threads of time. It is written that Lord Kroak and his peers were the ones to teach the first ancestors of the Elves to wield magic. These things and more has Kroak seen and it is said he is fated to endure until the last moment of the universe itself.

Lord.Name: Lord Mazdamundi
Lord.Description: Lord Mazdamundi, Lord of the Solar-City is the oldest and most powerful of the living Slann Mage-Priests and the current ruler of Hexoatl, the City of the Sun. At the Dawn of Creation, Lord Mazdamundi was instructed by none other than Lord Kroak himself, making Mazdamundi his successor. With a matchless mind unfathomable to others, Mazdamundi is obstinate in his ways and will not be deterred from that upon which he has decided.

Lord.Name: Kroq-Gar Ancient
Lord.Description: Kroq-Gar, known as the Last Defender of Xhotl is an ancient Saurus Oldblood, the last of the remaining Saurus warriors from the now ruined temple-city of Xhotl. The spawning that brought Kroq-Gar into the world produced a handful of other Saurus, each marked for greatness. In the instinctive ways of battle-cunning these warriors were unsurpassed by any of their kind, and each possessed an innate dominion over the native beasts of the jungle.

SpecialRules.Original: Strength 5 hit for any wound inflicted

HandWeapon.Rule: D6 Strength 4 hits within 12", bound spell Level 5

Lord.Name: Tehenhauin
Lord.Description: Tehenhauin is the name of the first and greatest Prophet of the Serpent God, Sotek. It began when Tehenhauin rallied the population of disease-ridden Chaqua, leading them out of that defiled city. Before he left, he claimed two treasures - a gleaming sacrificial blade and the hidden plaques of Chaqua, which proclaimed the coming of the Serpent God.

Original.Rule: All Skinks in army Hate all Skaven units

Lord.Name: Slann Mage-Priest
Lord.Description: The favoured servants of the Old Ones, the Slann have considerable intellect and magical abilities, and rule the Lizardmen as venerated Mage-Priests. Although not physically menacing - their bodies are toad-like with large heads and bulbous eyes - with a flick of their multi-jointed fingers, Slann can topple cities, engulf foes in flames or open vast vents in the ground below.

SlannOption.Name: Focus of Mystery
SlannOption.Rule: Mage-Priest knows every spell in lore

SlannOption.Name: Higher State
SlannOption.Rule: Only magical attacks have any effect

SlannOption.Name: Becalming Cogitation
SlannOption.Rule: Enemy Wizard discarded any roll 6 made

Lord.Name: Saurus Oldblood
Lord.Description: The most powerful of their kind, Saurus leaders are more than eight feet of savage reptilian muscle. The highest rank given is the title Oldblood, while those beneath them are known as Scar-Veterans. They are perfectly designed killing machines, their martial prowess further enhanced by battle experience. To their foes, be they ancient nemesis or simply those who trespass upon the sovereign territory of their masters, the Saurus leaders are nothing less than the vengeance of the Old Ones made manifest.

Hero.Name: Chakax
Hero.Description: Chakax, the Eternal Warden, is the greatest of the living Saurus Temple-Guards of the city of Xlanhuapec, the City of Mist. Very few warriors will ever prove worthy enough to protect a Slann Mage-Priest at his most vulnerable moments — when he meditates in his Eternity Chamber. Those few Saurus Temple Guard who earn such honours are given the sacred rank of Eternity Warden.

HandWeapon.Name: The Star-Stone Mace
HandWeapon.Rule: Enemy magic weapon count as mundane

Armour.Name: The Helm of Prime Guardian
Armour.Rule: No Scout may set up within 20"

Hero.Name: Gor-Rok
Hero.Description: Gor-Rok, the Great White Lizard, is amongst the greatest and most renowned Saurus in living memory. When Gor-Rok first emerged from the spawning pool of Itza, his size, pure albino colourings and lone arrival immediately marked him as a future champion. And so it has been — for the Great White Lizard, as Gor-Rok is also known, has fought in countless battles, his heavily scarred body a testament to many thousands of hard-fought triumphs.

Hero.Name: Tetto'eko
Hero.Description: Tetto'eko, Astronomer of the Constellations, is the Chief Astronomer of the Temple of the Eclipse in Tlaxtlan and one of the greatest Skink Priest the Lizardmen have ever known. His appearance on the battlefield heralds events of such importance that heavenly bodies have been known to realign themselves in his favour. Those sensitive to the skeins of destiny can feel its precarious balance as well as sense Tetto’eko’s uncanny ability to shift the winds of fate his own way.

Original.Rule: All spells from the Lore of Heavens

Hero.Name: Tiktaq'to
Hero.Description: Tiktaq'to is the current Master of Skies of the Temple-City of Hexoalt, and is considered by all to be the greatest of the Terradon Riders. When it comes to aerial combat and leading bold hit-and-run attacks, the Skink known as Tiktaq’to has no peers. Atop his particularly fierce Terradon, Zwup, Tiktaq’to leads his squadron of flying reptiles on reckless paths through dense vegetation or steep-sided valleys so narrow that the Terradons touch the edges with each flap of their mighty wings.

Original.Rule: May join units if Terradon Riders

Hero.Name: Oxyotl Survivor
Hero.Description: Oxyotl, known as "He That Hunts Unseen" is a legendary and much-feared Chameleon Skink who was at one time, the last and greatest Chameleon Hunter within the jungle-continent of Lustria, an ancient being who was alive when Chaos first came to this very world.

Hero.Name: Saurus Scar-Veteran
Hero.Description: Saurus Scar-Veterans, also known simply as Saurus Leaders, are the most powerful of their savage kind. More than simply eight feet of savage reptilian muscle, Scar-Veterans are perfectly designed killing machines, their martial prowess further enhanced by battle experience. To their foes, be they ancient nemesis or simply those who trespass upon the sovereign territory of their masters, the Saurus leaders are nothing less than the vengeance of the Old Ones made manifest.

Hero.Name: Skink Priest
Hero.Description: On occasion, a Skink spawning will not produce an entire cohort from the pools of life, as is the norm, but instead only a single Skink will issue forth. These individuals are marked by the Old Ones and destined to lead, or otherwise achieve greatness amongst their kind. Those Skinks attuned to the energies of the world and that show an aptitude for magic are the Skink Priests, the most intelligent of their kind. Their role is to become the personal attendants of the mighty Slann Mage-Priests, and act as the prophets of the Lizardmen.

Hero.Name: Skink Chief
Hero.Description: Skink Chiefs are the leaders of Skink society, second only in command to the Skink Priests. In the Lizardmen chain of command, Skink Priests direct their orders to Skink Chiefs. These are Skinks who have been marked for greatness. While the Priests attend to prophecies, it is left to the Skink Chiefs to execute orders.

Core.Name: Saurus Warrior
Core.Description: Saurus are brutish yet disciplined creatures. Even unarmed, they are extremely dangerous — their sharp claws can gouge grooves into rock or tear out a foe’s throat with ease. Their muscular tails can smash a man’s ribcage and their mouths are full of enormous dagger-shaped teeth.

Core.Name: Skinks
Core.Description: Skinks take up weapons during their many patrols as well as to join the fighting during times of war. As troops, they range between reckless audacity and sudden panic. Their skittish nature makes them much more prone to fleeing than the stoic Saurus. They are typically used in two different types of formation. Most commonly, the Skinks advance before the bulk of the main army, harassing the foe’s advance with hails of darts.

Core.Name: Skink Skirmishers
Core.Description: A unit of mobile skirmishers who utilize blow pipes laced with darts that are covered with venoms and poisons from all of Lustria's creatures.

Core.Name: Jungle swarm
Core.Description: When threatened by invaders or when amassing an army to march on distant lands, a Skink Priest will call unto himself one of the jungle swarms. What crawls, creeps and slithers forth is mind-boggling for warmbloods to behold — a living carpet of creatures that moves in a writhing mass. In battle, they wash around the legs of a foe in a wave, hissing, spitting and plunging sharp fangs into unprotected flesh. The smallest of their kind can slip between even the slightest crack or armoured joint to deliver a mortal sting.

Special.Name: Chameleon Skinks
Special.Description: Chameleon Skinks do not dwell within the temple-cities, but instead strike out deep into the Lustrian jungles. Some spawnings roam in groups across the land, while others instinctively guard a home territory — most often a neglected monument long lost to the jungle. From there, they join Skink patrols and stalk rogue beasts when they inadvertently enter sacred grounds.

Special.Name: Terradon Riders
Special.Description: Skinks have mastered the art of riding Terradons by capturing Terradon hatchlings young enough that the beasts bond with their future riders — no easy matter considering the height and precariousness of Terradon lairs. There is a great demand for these Terradon Riders as messengers and scouts, and they are exceptionally useful in battle.

Special.Name: Temple Guard
Special.Description: The Temple Guard are a revered and uncommon spawning of Saurus. They were created to protect the Slann Mage-Priests and the temple-cities in which the Lizardmen dwell. To their tasks, they dedicate every fibre of their beings, displaying a single-minded determination that will result in either the safeguarding of their charges or their own deaths.

Special.Name: Cold One Cavalry
Special.Description: The Cold Ones are foul-tempered and dim-witted reptilian creatures. They emerge from subterranean lairs to prowl in packs throughout Lustria. They are hunched bipedal beasts with muscular legs, but when Cold Ones move at speed, they often use their forelimbs for balance and to achieve a more rapid pace. These shortened arms come into their own, however, at the conclusion of a hunt.

Special.Name: Kroxigor
Special.Description: Kroxigor are giant crocodilian relatives of the Saurus. They are hulking creatures, their bodies consisting of slabs of rock-hard muscle and their massive jaws bristling with razor-sharp teeth. They move in silence, save for the heavy thumping tread of their feet. When enraged, they unleash their only form of speech — a blood-curdling roar that reverberates across the jungle.

Special.Name: Stegadon
Special.Description: Stegadons are mighty beasts that have dwelt within the primeval jungles since long before the coming of the Old Ones. They are bulky creatures whose heads are covered by armoured crests, out of which project massive horns. With bony scales and spikes shielding their bodies, there are few predators that dare challenge them.

Rare.Name: Ancient stegadon
Rare.Description: Ancient Stegadon are amongst the oldest and most ferocious of their entire species, powerful behemoths that have endured the harshest life possible for any creature living within the hazardous jungles of Lustria. Covered in scars that criss-cross its entire body, this shows to all that this monster has fought, bled and killed everything the jungle has sent against him, and it shall do so again.

Rare.Name: Salamander Hunting Pack
Rare.Description: Salamanders are giant, predatory creatures that stalk the swamplands and estuaries of Lustria’s jungles. Propelled by four thickly muscled legs and a powerful tail, they are swift-moving creatures whether on land or in water. Salamanders are voracious hunters, and their favoured method of catching prey is to swiftly close the distance, moving through underbrush or even submerged under water.

Rare.Name: Razordon Hunting Pack
Rare.Description: Barbed Razordons are covered with a profusion of great spines — hardened spikes made of bone that project menacingly out of their bodies. As a defensive protection, this razor-sharp body armour serves to deter all but the most determined of creatures, and even the most monstrous of Lustria’s many apex predators will think twice before attacking a Razordon.
